synopsis: Professor Saotome creats a robot so powerful it overwhelms ordinary pilots. To deafter the monstrous oni, he recruits a masterful fighter to be his first pilot - Ryoma Nagare.
Needing three pilots for the getter robo, the professor takes a chance on the blood-crazed learder of the revolution, Hayato Jin!
Professor Saotome discovers his final pilot when he finds the gigantic Buddhist, Benkei Musashibou, the only survivor of his temple after the oni attacked.
To perform at its peak, the getter robo requires synchronization of the three pilots. So how can the getter robo attack so well when the pilots always fight each other?
After a fierce battle, Ryoma and the gang chase the enemy into a mysterious dark cloud in the sky. What is waiting for them at the end of the whirlwind?

title.jp: The Mansion Where the Oni Dwell

synopsis: Ryoma finds himself in an alternate Heian-era Japan. Can he unite with the getter robo and his team?
Ryoma and the mighty Shogun Raiko Minamoto face off against a powerful enemy, Seimei Abe, the Yin-Yang Master.
The final showdown between Seimei and the three get machine pilots breaks out and the army of Raiko and the mob of the Oni join them.
When Ryoma and the gang finally return to the Saotome lab, they realize three years had been passed.
Seimei is back in the present time. He swears revenge on the Getter Robo.
Afer the fierce battle with Seimi Robo, Benkei notices a mysterious connection between Ryoma and the newly powered-up Getter Robo.
Four "Gods" appears from the sky and start destroying all prototype Getter Robos. Seeing how invincible these "Gods" are, professor Saotome decides to take drastic measures.
THe final battle with the four "Gods" leads Getter Robo to the mysterious "Space" underneath the Earth.
